Description: Body sherd of Chian Mature Animal Style pottery chalice; white slip; interior: glazed streaky black (mostly lost); traces of faded added white bands; exterior: painted decoration consisting of shoulder and neck of bull to right.
Curator's comments: Lemos describes the sherd as belonging to the Group of Light-Walled Naukratis Animal Chalices. All sherds in this group are small and offer very little by way of information beyond the fact that they come from light-walled chalices. The decoration on sherds belonging to this group is also poorly or carelessly drawn (Lemos 1991, 93).
Thickness of wall, at 0.6, suggests that it does not belong to the Light-walled group.
Bibliographic references: Lemos 1991 / Archaic Pottery of Chios. The Decorated Styles (p. 93, p. 262, no. 541)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GD.0524) (phase 2)
